SEARCH
Package com.dua3.utility.i18n

Class I18N

java.lang.Object
com.dua3.utility.i18n.I18N
public final class I18N extends Object
The I18N class provides internationalization support for applications. It retrieves localized strings from one or more resource bundles based on the requested locale.

This class is intended to control resource management in internationalized environments. The Application class should instantiate a single instance of this class with its main ResourceBundle. The getLocale() method will return the locale of the main bundle, and it should be passed down to used libraries so that those can select the appropriate resource bundle for that locale. This prevents the main application falling back to the default locale while the libraries using another locale, for example, if the application runs on a system configured to use a French locale but not providing a bundle matching that locale, this prevents mixed output using english texts from the application bundle and French texts from the library bundle.

If the library is built using the I18N class, it should not directly use the library bundle but instead use mergeBundle(ResourceBundle) to add its own bundle to the instance. Only keys not yet present will be added to the I18N instance. This makes it possible for the application to customize library resources by adding a mapping for the library resource key to be customized.

The application should implement the I18NProvider interface to announce the I18N instance to libraries. Once initialised, libraries can get the instance using getInstance() and merge their own bundles.

    • create

      public static I18N create(String baseName, Locale locale)

      Parameters:
      baseName - The base name of the resource bundle.
      locale - The locale to be used for localization.
      Returns:
      An instance of the I18N class.

    • getResourceBundle

      public static ResourceBundle getResourceBundle(String baseName, Locale locale)
      Retrieves a ResourceBundle for the given base name and locale. If the requested locale is not available, logs a message and falls back to the closest matching locale or the default bundle.
      Parameters:
      baseName - The base name of the resource bundle.
      locale - The requested locale for which the resource bundle is sought.
      Returns:
      The ResourceBundle corresponding to the given base name and locale.

    • create

      public static I18N create(ResourceBundle bundle)
      Creates an instance of the I18N class with the provided resource bundle.
      Parameters:
      bundle - The resource bundle to use.
      Returns:
      An instance of the I18N class.

    • mergeBundle

      public void mergeBundle(String baseName, Locale locale)
      Merges a resource bundle identified by its base name and locale into the internal bundleMap.
      Parameters:
      baseName - The base name of the resource bundle.
      locale - The locale associated with the resource bundle.

    • mergeBundle

      public void mergeBundle(ResourceBundle bundle)
      Merges the given resource bundle into the internal bundleMap.
      Parameters:
      bundle - The resource bundle to merge.

    • lookupBundle

      public ResourceBundle lookupBundle(String key)
      Retrieves the ResourceBundle associated with the given key from the bundleMap. If the key is not found, the mainBundle is returned.
      Parameters:
      key - The key to lookup in the bundleMap.
      Returns:
      The retrieved ResourceBundle or the mainBundle if the key is not found.

    • getBundle

      public Optional<ResourceBundle> getBundle(String key)
      Retrieves the ResourceBundle associated with the given key from the bundleMap. If the key is not found, an empty Optional is returned.
      Parameters:
      key - The key to lookup in the bundleMap.
      Returns:
      Optional containing the bundle the key is mapped to

    • lookupBundle

      public Optional<ResourceBundle> lookupBundle(String key, Function<Locale,ResourceBundle> bundleLoader)
      Retrieves the ResourceBundle associated with the given key from the bundleMap. If the key is not found, a new bundle is loaded using the supplied loader, and if the key is contained in the new bundle, the new bundle is merged and returned.
      Parameters:
      key - The key to lookup in the bundleMap.
      bundleLoader - The function used to load the ResourceBundle for the given locale.
      Returns:
      The ResourceBundle containing the key, or null if the key is not found.

    • getLocale

      public Locale getLocale()
      Retrieves the locale used for localization.
      Returns:
      The locale used for localization.

    • getObject

      public Object getObject(String key)
      Retrieves the object for the given key from the resource bundle.
      Parameters:
      key - the key that represents the string to be retrieved.
      Returns:
      the object bound to the given key.
      See Also:
      • ResourceBundle.getObject(String)

    • get

      public String get(String key)
      Retrieves the localized string for the given key from the resource bundle.
      Parameters:
      key - The key that represents the string to be retrieved.
      Returns:
      The localized string for the given key.
      Throws:
      MissingResourceException - – if no object for the given key can be found
      ClassCastException - – if the object found for the given key is not a string
      See Also:
      • ResourceBundle.getString(String)

    • getOrCompute

      public String getOrCompute(String key, Function<? super String,String> compute)
      Retrieves the localized string for the given key from the resource bundle or computes a result if the key is not mapped.

      The computed value is not added to this instance.

      Parameters:
      key - The key that represents the string to be retrieved.
      compute - the function that computes values for unmapped keys
      Returns:
      The localized string for the given key.
      See Also:
      • ResourceBundle.getString(String)

    • format

      public String format(String key, Object... args)
      Retrieves the formatted localized string for the given key from the resource bundle, using the provided arguments.
      Parameters:
      key - The key that represents the string pattern to be retrieved.
      args - The arguments to be formatted into the string pattern.
      Returns:
      The formatted string for the given key and arguments.
      See Also:
      • ResourceBundle.getString(String)
      • MessageFormat.format(String, Object...)

    • containsKey

      public boolean containsKey(String key)
      Checks if the given key is present in the bundleMap.
      Parameters:

      Returns:
